original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Distilleries Company of Sri Lanka Plc has acquired HEINEKEN Lanka Limited, which produces Heineken, Tiger, and Anchor, it announced.

“Distilleries Company of Sri Lanka Plc has acquired 99.4% of the issued capital of HEINEKEN Lanka Limited from HEINEKEN Asia Pacific Pte Ltd for a total consideration of Euro 12 million,” the company said in a stock exchange filing.
“This acquisition and the continued production of world-renowned Heineken brands under license will ensure that consumers can continue to enjoy these brands.”
The company said it will continue brewing beer under world-renowned international brands such as Heineken, Tiger, and Anchor under a Trademark Licence Agreement signed with the HEINEKEN Company.
Distilleries said it will also continue to brew its own brand, Bison beer.
“With this acquisition, HEINEKEN Lanka Limited will change its name to DCSL Breweries Lanka Limited to reflect the new ownership.”
Distilleries announced that it had signed a Sales and Purchase Agreement to acquire shares in Heineken Lanka Limited last November.
The purchase of Heineken Lanka by Distilleries Corporation of Sri Lanka, a hard alcohol maker, will intensify competition challenging Lion beer, Fitch Ratings said at the time:

“Lion Brewery (Ceylon) PLC (AAA(lka)/Stable), the leader in Sri Lanka’s beer market, could face more competition in the medium term following Distilleries Company of Sri Lanka PLC’s (DIST; AAA(lka)/Stable) decision to acquire beer producer Heineken Lanka Limited.

“Heineken is a distant second in Sri Lanka’s beer market for now, but we believe DIST has the industry know-how, market access and financial strength to elevate Heineken’s operations to a level that could weigh on Lion’s market share.”
Distilleries Company shares were trading up at 27.70, Thursday (11) after the announcement. Lion Brewery (Ceylon) Plc shares were trading up at 945.00. (Colombo/Jan11/2024)
